title: NEAIRA
content:
NEAIRA (Neaera) was a Naiad-nymph of Edonia in Thrake (north of Greece). She was the wife of the river-god
        Strymon.

Neaira (New-Rising) was probably the Okeanid-nymph of the springs of the river
        Strymon.

NEAERA (Neaira). The wife of Strymon, and mother of Evadne. (Apollod. ii. ยง 2.)

Source: Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology.

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 2. 3 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "He [Argos son of Zeus] got the rule and named the Peloponnesos Argos after himself. He married Euadne
        (Evadne), the daughter of Strymon and Neaira (Neaera)."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
